skill.name: ghe-transition
skill.description: Changes phases in the GitHub Elements workflow by closing the current thread and opening the next phase thread. Use when user wants to END current phase and BEGIN next (e.g., "transition to TEST", "move to REVIEW", "demote to DEV", "merge this"). Do NOT use for status checks, claiming issues, saving progress, or generating reports.
skill.summary: Changes phases in the GitHub Elements workflow by closing the current thread and opening the next ph...
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. C2 keywords triggered by workflow terms (transition, phase), weak crypto alerts by documentation references, and external_command patterns by documentation mentions. The skill is a legitimate GitHub workflow management tool with no executable code.

content.value_statement: Managing GitHub workflow phases manually causes delays and errors. This skill automates phase transitions by closing current threads and opening the next phase thread in the GitHub Elements workflow.
actual_capabilities: Close the current workflow phase thread in GitHub Elements
Open the next phase thread in the GitHub Elements workflow
Transition through standard workflow phases (DEV, TEST, REVIEW, PRODUCTION)
Handle phase demotions (e.g., moving back to DEV from REVIEW)
limitations: Only works with GitHub Elements workflow system
Does not perform status checks on issues or pull requests
Does not generate reports or save workflow state

use_cases.title: Development Team Lead
use_cases.description: Move completed development work from DEV phase to TEST phase for QA review.

use_cases.title: QA Engineer
use_cases.description: Transition validated work from TEST to REVIEW for final approval before production.

use_cases.title: DevOps Engineer
use_cases.description: Demote issues back to DEV phase when fixes are needed after testing failure.

prompt_templates.title: Simple Phase Transition
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the ghe-transition skill to transition [issue number] to [phase name]. For example: transition issue #123 to TEST
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to move an issue to the next workflow phase

prompt_templates.title: Demote to Earlier Phase
prompt_templates.prompt: Use ghe-transition to move [issue number] back to DEV phase. This is a demotion.
prompt_templates.scenario: When work needs to be sent back for revision

prompt_templates.title: Merge to Production
prompt_templates.prompt: Use ghe-transition to merge [issue number] to PRODUCTION. This is the final production deployment phase.

prompt_templates.title: Batch Transitions
prompt_templates.prompt: Use ghe-transition to transition multiple issues to REVIEW phase: [list issue numbers]
prompt_templates.scenario: When moving multiple completed items through workflow

output_examples.output: Successfully transitioned issue #42 from DEV phase to TEST phase. The TEST phase thread has been opened.
Issue #99 has been demoted from REVIEW to DEV phase. The DEV phase thread is now active.

best_practices: Verify the issue number is correct before initiating a transition
Ensure all required criteria for the target phase are met
Use clear language: 'transition to PHASE' for promotions, 'demote to PHASE' for backward movement
anti_patterns: Do not use for checking issue status - this skill is for transitions only
Do not use to claim or assign issues to team members
Do not generate reports or save progress using this skill

faq.question: What phases are supported?
faq.answer: Standard phases include DEV, TEST, REVIEW, and PRODUCTION. Your organization may have custom phases configured.

faq.question: Can I transition multiple issues at once?
faq.answer: Yes, you can list multiple issue numbers in a single transition request.

faq.question: What happens if I use the wrong phase name?
faq.answer: The skill will return an error indicating the phase is not recognized. Verify your workflow configuration.

faq.question: Does this skill work with private repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, as long as you have appropriate permissions to access and modify issues in the repository.

faq.question: Can I transition issues across different repositories?
faq.answer: No, each transition operates within a single repository context.

faq.question: Is there a limit on how often I can transition issues?
faq.answer: No limits are imposed by the skill itself. Check your GitHub repository settings for any workflow restrictions.
